00049 static __inline__ unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long word) {
00050     /* Derived from bitops.h's ffs() */
00051     __asm__("bsfl %1, %0"
00052             : "=r" (word)
00053             : "r"  (word));
00054     return word;
00055 }
00056 
00057 static inline unsigned long long rtai_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00058                                               unsigned long uld,
00059                                               unsigned long *r) {
00060     /*
00061      * Fixed by Marco Morandini <morandini@aero.polimi.it> to work
00062      * with the -fnostrict-aliasing and -O2 combination using GCC
00063      * 3.x.
00064      */
00065 
00066     unsigned long long qf, rf;
00067     unsigned long tq, rh;
00068     union { unsigned long long ull; unsigned long ul[2]; } p, q;
00069 
00070     p.ull = ull;
00071     q.ull = 0;
00072     rf = 0x100000000ULL - (qf = 0xFFFFFFFFUL / uld) * uld;
00073 
00074     while (p.ull >= uld) {
00075         q.ul[1] += (tq = p.ul[1] / uld);
00076         rh = p.ul[1] - tq * uld;
00077         q.ull  += rh * qf + (tq = p.ul[0] / uld);
00078         p.ull   = rh * rf + (p.ul[0] - tq * uld);
00079     }
00080 
00081     if (r)
00082         *r = p.ull;
00083 
00084     return q.ull;
00085 }
00086 
00087 static inline int rtai_imuldiv (int i, int mult, int div) {
00088 
00089     /* Returns (int)i = (int)i*(int)(mult)/(int)div. */
00090     
00091     int dummy;
00092 
00093     __asm__ __volatile__ ( \
00094         "mull %%edx\t\n" \
00095         "div %%ecx\t\n" \
00096         : "=a" (i), "=d" (dummy)
00097         : "a" (i), "d" (mult), "c" (div));
00098 
00099     return i;
00100 }
00101 
00102 static inline long long rtai_llimd(long long ll, int mult, int div) {
00103 
00104     /* Returns (long long)ll = (int)ll*(int)(mult)/(int)div. */
00105 
00106     __asm__ __volatile ( \
00107         "movl %%edx,%%ecx\t\n" \
00108         "mull %%esi\t\n" \
00109         "movl %%eax,%%ebx\n\t" \
00110         "movl %%ecx,%%eax\t\n" \
00111         "movl %%edx,%%ecx\t\n" \
00112         "mull %%esi\n\t" \
00113         "addl %%ecx,%%eax\t\n" \
00114         "adcl $0,%%edx\t\n" \
00115         "divl %%edi\n\t" \
00116         "movl %%eax,%%ecx\t\n" \
00117         "movl %%ebx,%%eax\t\n" \
00118         "divl %%edi\n\t" \
00119         "sal $1,%%edx\t\n" \
00120         "cmpl %%edx,%%edi\t\n" \
00121         "movl %%ecx,%%edx\n\t" \
00122         "jge 1f\t\n" \
00123         "addl $1,%%eax\t\n" \
00124         "adcl $0,%%edx\t\n" \
00125         "1:\t\n" \
00126         : "=A" (ll) \
00127         : "A" (ll), "S" (mult), "D" (div) \
00128         : "%ebx", "%ecx");
00129 
00130     return ll;
00131 }

00133 /*
00134  *  u64div32c.c is a helper function provided, 2003-03-03, by:
00135  *  Copyright (C) 2003 Nils Hagge <hagge@rts.uni-hannover.de>
00136  */
00137 
00138 static inline unsigned long long rtai_u64div32c(unsigned long long a,
00139                                                 unsigned long b,
00140                                                 int *r) {
00141     __asm__ __volatile(
00142        "\n        movl    %%eax,%%ebx"
00143        "\n        movl    %%edx,%%eax"
00144        "\n        xorl    %%edx,%%edx"
00145        "\n        divl    %%ecx"
00146        "\n        xchgl   %%eax,%%ebx"
00147        "\n        divl    %%ecx"
00148        "\n        movl    %%edx,%%ecx"
00149        "\n        movl    %%ebx,%%edx"
00150        : "=a" (((unsigned long *)((void *)&a))[0]), "=d" (((unsigned long *)((void *)&a))[1])
00151        : "a" (((unsigned long *)((void *)&a))[0]), "d" (((unsigned long *)((void *)&a))[1]), "c" (b)
00152        : "%ebx"
00153        );
00154 
00155     return a;
00156 }

00226 static inline unsigned long long rtai_rdtsc (void) {

00280 /* rtai_get_current() is Adeos-specific. Since real-time interrupt
00281    handlers are called on behalf of the RTAI domain stack, we cannot
00282    infere the "current" Linux task address using %esp. We must use the
00283    suspended Linux domain's stack pointer instead. */
00284 
00285 static inline struct task_struct *rtai_get_root_current (int cpuid)
00286 
00287 {
00288 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < KERNEL_VERSION(2,6,0)
00289     return (struct task_struct *)(((u_long)adp_root->esp[cpuid]) & (~8191UL));
00290 #else /* LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= KERNEL_VERSION(2,6,0) */
00291     return ((struct thread_info *)(((u_long)adp_root->esp[cpuid]) & (~((THREAD_SIZE)-1))))->task;
00292 #endif /* LINUX_VERSION_CODE < KERNEL_VERSION(2,6,0) */
00293 }
00294 
00295 static inline int rtai_adeos_stack_p (int cpuid)
00296 
00297 {
00298     int *esp;
00299     __asm__ volatile("movl %%esp, %0" : "=r" (esp));
00300     return (esp >= rtai_domain.estackbase[cpuid] && esp < rtai_domain.estackbase[cpuid] + 2048);
00301 }
00302 
00303 static inline struct task_struct *rtai_get_current (int cpuid)
00304 
00305 {
00306     if (rtai_adeos_stack_p(cpuid))
00307         return rtai_get_root_current(cpuid);
00308 
00309     return get_current();
00310 }
00311 
00312 #else /* CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */
00313

00315 
00316 {
00317     return current;
00318 }
00319 
00320 static inline struct task_struct *rtai_get_current (int cpuid)
00321 
00322 {
00323     return current;

00326 #endif /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */

00337 #define _send_sched_ipi(dest) \
00338 do { \
00339         apic_wait_icr_idle(); \
00340         apic_write_around(APIC_ICR2, SET_APIC_DEST_FIELD(dest)); \
00341         apic_write_around(APIC_ICR, APIC_DEST_LOGICAL | SCHED_VECTOR); \
00342 } while (0)

00352 static inline void rt_spin_lock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00353 
00354     rtai_cli();
00355     rt_spin_lock(lock);
00356 }
00357 
00358 static inline void rt_spin_unlock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00359 
00360     rt_spin_unlock(lock);
00361     rtai_sti();
00362 }

00372 static inline void rt_spin_unlock_irqrestore(unsigned long flags,
00373                                              spinlock_t *lock) {
00374     rt_spin_unlock(lock);
00375     rtai_local_irq_restore(flags);

00378 #define CPU_RELAX(x) cpu_relax()
00379 
00380 static inline void rt_get_global_lock(void) {
00381 
00382     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00383 
00384     rtai_cli();
00385 
00386 #ifdef adeos_load_cpuid
00387     adeos_load_cpuid();
00388 #endif /* adeos_load_cpuid */
00389 
00390     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,&rtai_cpu_lock))
00391         while (test_and_set_bit(31,&rtai_cpu_lock))
00392             CPU_RELAX(cpuid);
00393 }
00394 
00395 static inline void rt_release_global_lock(void) {
00396 
00397     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00398 
00399     rtai_cli();
00400 
00401 #ifdef adeos_load_cpuid
00402     adeos_load_cpuid();
00403 #endif /* adeos_load_cpuid */
00404 
00405     if (test_and_clear_bit(cpuid,&rtai_cpu_lock)) {
00406         test_and_clear_bit(31,&rtai_cpu_lock);
00407         CPU_RELAX(cpuid);
00408     }
00409 }
00410 
00423 static inline void rt_global_cli(void) {
00424     rt_get_global_lock();
00425 }
00426 
00433 static inline void rt_global_sti(void) {
00434     rt_release_global_lock();
00435     rtai_sti();
00436 }
00437 
00444 static inline int rt_global_save_flags_and_cli(void) {
00445 
00446     unsigned long flags = rtai_get_iflag_and_cli();
00447     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00448 
00449 #ifdef adeos_load_cpuid
00450     adeos_load_cpuid();
00451 #endif /* adeos_load_cpuid */
00452 
00453     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,&rtai_cpu_lock))
00454         {
00455         while (test_and_set_bit(31,&rtai_cpu_lock))
00456             CPU_RELAX(cpuid);
00457         return flags | 1;
00458         }
00459 
00460     return flags;
00461 }
00462 
00470 static inline void rt_global_save_flags(unsigned long *flags) {
00471 
00472     unsigned long hflags = rtai_get_iflag_and_cli(), rflags;
00473     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00474 
00475 #ifdef adeos_load_cpuid
00476     adeos_load_cpuid();
00477 #endif /* adeos_load_cpuid */
00478 
00479     if (test_bit(cpuid,&rtai_cpu_lock))
00480         rflags = hflags;
00481     else
00482         rflags = hflags | 1;
00483 
00484     if (hflags)
00485         rtai_sti();
00486 
00487     *flags = rflags;
00488 }
00489 
00497 static inline void rt_global_restore_flags(unsigned long flags) {
00498 
00499     switch (flags)
00500         {
00501         case (1 << RTAI_IFLAG) | 1:
00502 
00503             rt_release_global_lock();
00504             rtai_sti();
00505             break;
00506 
00507         case (1 << RTAI_IFLAG) | 0:
00508 
00509             rt_get_global_lock();
00510             rtai_sti();
00511             break;
00512 
00513         case (0 << RTAI_IFLAG) | 1:
00514 
00515             rt_release_global_lock();
00516             break;
00517 
00518         case (0 << RTAI_IFLAG) | 0:
00519 
00520             rt_get_global_lock();
00521             break;
00522         }
00523 }

00563 static inline void rt_switch_to_real_time(int cpuid)
00564 {
00565         TRACE_RTAI_SWITCHTO_RT(cpuid);
00566         if (!rtai_linux_context[cpuid].depth++) {
00567                 rtai_linux_local_irq_save(rtai_linux_context[cpuid].oldflags);
00568                 test_and_set_bit(cpuid,&rtai_cpu_realtime);
00569         }
00570 }
00571 
00572 static inline int rt_switch_to_linux(int cpuid)
00573 {
00574         TRACE_RTAI_SWITCHTO_LINUX(cpuid);
00575         if (rtai_linux_context[cpuid].depth) {
00576                 if (!--rtai_linux_context[cpuid].depth) {
00577                         test_and_clear_bit(cpuid,&rtai_cpu_realtime);
00578                         rtai_linux_local_irq_restore_nosync(rtai_linux_context[cpuid].oldflags, cpuid);
00579                 }
00580                 return 0;
00581         }
00582         return 1;
00583 }
00584 
00585 #define in_hrt_mode(cpuid)  (test_bit(cpuid, &rtai_cpu_realtime))
00586 
00587 static inline void rt_set_timer_delay (int delay) {
00588 
00589     if (delay) {
00590         unsigned long flags;
00591         rtai_hw_lock(flags);
00592 #ifdef __USE_APIC__
00593         apic_read(APIC_TMICT);
00594         apic_write(APIC_TMICT,delay);
00595 #else /* !__USE_APIC__ */
00596         outb(delay & 0xff,0x40);
00597         outb(delay >> 8,0x40);
00598 #endif /* __USE_APIC__ */
00599         rtai_hw_unlock(flags);
00600     }
00601 }
